descript.abstract: This is a mathematically generated grid in which each polygon represents one quarter of a standard USGS 7 1/2 minute quadrangle. The result is a 3 3/4 minute quadrangle layer which nests within the standard USGS quads and whose tile naming scheme includes reference to the parent quadrangles. Known as the "Quarter Quad" tile index.
descript.purpose: To provide a standard framework for accessing and creating data sets tiled by "quarter-quad."

idinfo.useconst: Use of the data are constrained only by the DNR GIS Data License Agreement

attracc.attraccr: Source table INDX_QQ24KPY4.DBF: Not Specifically Assessed

dataqual.logic: All polygons are closed and lines intersect where intended.
dataqual.complete: All 3 3/4 minute blocks that fall entirely or partially within the state Minnesota are included.

procstep.procdesc: Attribute Lineage for source table INDX_QQ24KPY4.DBF: Attributes were derived directly from the parent coverage (q024ine4). Each polygon was assigned the tile-name of the parent polygon, with the designation nw,ne,sw,se appended, depending on what quadrant of the original 7 1/2 minute quadrangle the polygon represented. Transfer of attributes was accomplished via AML programming at the same time as the cartographic representation was created.

attr.attrdef: The UTM zone for which the coordinates of the label point was calculated. In this case, all of the UTM_ZONE values are given as 0 (i.e., they have not been calculated). Since the coverage is in UTM, zone 15, extended, the values should be 15. Field is part of the default set of attributes used by MGS.
Holds long name of quarter quad tile, typically the seven and one-half minute quad name with directional quadrant identifier (e.g. sw) appended to it.

distinfo.distliab: The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement is online: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/sitetools/data_software_license.html

stdorder.ordering: Please visit the download page for this dataset on the Minnesota Geospatial Commons website using the web link below (Online Linkage).
